qas.question: What sort of equipment uses the infrared spectrum in the absence of sufficient visible light?
What do night vision devices convert ambient light photons into?
Along with a chemical process, what type of process is used by night vision devices to convert infrared into visible light?
What equipment uses the infrared spectrum with visible light?
What do night vision devices convert electrons into?
By what process do night vision devices convert infrared into photons?
What process uses a chemical source to augment ambient light?
What does a visible light source increase for a night vision device?

context: Infrared is used in <a0_0><b3_0>night vision<b3_0/><a0_0/> equipment when there is insufficient visible light to see. Night vision devices operate through a process involving the conversion of ambient light <b4_0>photons<b4_0/> into <a1_0>electrons<a1_0/> that are then amplified by a chemical and <a2_0><b5_0>electrical<b5_0/><a2_0/> process and then converted back into visible light. Infrared light sources can be used to augment the available ambient light for <b6_0>conversion<b6_0/> by night vision devices, increasing <b7_0>in-the-dark visibility<b7_0/> without actually using a visible light source.
